intro: Uvaria purpurea var. alba, commonly known as white uvaria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red when mature. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded forest understories. The flowers are fragrant and attract various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
